result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michael A. Goen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant shall not commit any criminal offenses during the period of this agreement.  The defendant shall notify the Taylor County District Attorney's Office as well as the Clerk of Court's Office, of any change of address within 10 days of said change.   Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim within 30 days of sentencing.  The letter must be submitted to and approved by his probation agent.

Prior to the expiration of this agreement, the defendant must undergo an AODA and all recommended follow-through treatment.  Proof of assessment must be provided to the Taylor County District Attorney's Office.

judgments.dispoDesc: Pursuant to an agreement and on motion of the state, the court granted a deferred entry of judgment for a period of one year.  Upon successful completion of the agreement, the state will move to dismiss the felony charge.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victim.  The letter has been done and submitted to the district attorney's office. Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with any recommendations.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections.  If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A. Goen

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant Michael A. Goen in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Information to be filed that mirrors the criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to counts 1 and 2.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Statement by defendant.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 and count 2.  Court orders in Count 2 a withheld sentence probation for one year; conditions - court costs; DNA surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; letter of apology which has been submitted to the DA's office; AODA and follow though with any recommendations.  Count 1 - courts enters a deferred agreement for one year.  - rt
to Modify Bond to Allow travel out of state.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall have no contact with S.M.N. dob: 2-07-1980.

Defendant Michael A. Goen in court with attorney Justin D. Wolff.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.   Court orders $2,000.00 signature bond; booking no contact with S.M.M.  dob 2-7-80 and not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  - rt
